private-limited-company.title: Private Limited Company Registration
private-limited-company.description: Transform your business idea into a legally recognized entity with complete liability protection and professional credibility.

includes: All Govt. Fees (Capital of Rs. 1 Lac)
PAN + TAN + PF + ESIC + Professional Tax

whatIs.title: What is a Private Limited Company?
whatIs.description: A Private Limited Company is a type of business entity where shareholders' liability is limited to their investment, and shares cannot be publicly traded. It's a separate legal entity from its owners, offering personal asset protection and enhanced credibility.

process.title: Name Reservation
process.description: Apply for Name Reservation through MCA portal with up to 2 name options.

process.title: Obtain DSC & DIN
process.description: Obtain Digital Signature Certificate and Director Identification Number.

process.title: Drafting of eMoA & eAoA
process.description: Prepare MOA and AOA for Business.

process.title: Filing SPICe+ Form
process.description: File incorporation forms with MCA.

process.title: Certificate of Registration
process.description: Receive Certificate of Incorporation from MCA.

process.title: Obtain other Registration
process.description: Obtain PAN, TAN, PF, ESIC and Profession Tax.

forDirectors: Bank statement/utility bill for address proof

faqs.question: What is the minimum capital required for Private Limited Company?
faqs.answer: There is no minimum capital requirement as per the Companies Act 2013. You can start with a nominal paid-up capital of ₹1 lakh or even less.

faqs.question: How many directors are required to start Private Limited Company?
faqs.answer: A minimum of 2 and maximum of 15 directors are required. At least one director must be a resident Indian.

faqs.question: How many shareholders are required to register a Private Limited Company?
faqs.answer: Private Limited Company must have a minimum of 2 shareholders and a maximum of 200 shareholders.

faqs.question: Can a salaried person be a director?
faqs.answer: Yes, a salaried person can be a director unless their employment contract specifically prohibits it.

faqs.question: How long does it take to register a Private Limited Company in India?
faqs.answer: The registration process for a Private Limited Company can typically take anywhere from 15 to 20 days, depending on various factors.

faqs.question: Can foreign nationals be shareholders in a Private Limited Company in India?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign nationals are allowed to be shareholders in a Private Limited Company as long as they comply with the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) guidelines.

faqs.question: Is a physical office address mandatory for registration?
faqs.answer: Yes, a registered office address in India is mandatory for all official communications and must be provided with proof (e.g., utility bill, rent agreement + NOC).

faqs.question: What is a Corporate Identification Number (CIN)?
faqs.answer: The Corporate Identification Number (CIN) is a unique identifier issued by the Registrar of Companies (RoC) upon a company's incorporation, serving as its official identity.

faqs.question: Can I register a Private Limited Company from my residential address?
faqs.answer: Yes, a Private Limited Company can be registered at a residential address in India, provided you submit valid address proof like a recent utility bill or a rental agreement with an NOC from the landlord.

faqs.question: Why the Memorandum of Association (MOA) and Articles of Association (AOA) are crucial legal documents?
faqs.answer: The Memorandum of Association (MOA) defines the company's objectives and scope, while the Articles of Association (AOA) outlines its internal rules and regulations. Both are crucial for legal operation and must be submitted during registration.

faqs.question: Why Digital Signature Certificates (DSC) and Director Identification Numbers (DIN) are mandatory?
faqs.answer: DSCs are mandatory for directors and subscribers to digitally sign online forms on the MCA portal. DINs are unique identification numbers required for all company directors, essential for the online registration process.

opc-registration.title: One Person Company (OPC) Registration in India Online
opc-registration.description: Register your One Person Company (OPC) in India in 12–15 days. Full MCA process, DSC, DIN & compliance. Free expert consultation.

includes: All Govt. Fees (Capital of Rs. 1 Lac)

whatIs.title: What is One Person Company?
whatIs.description: A One Person Company (OPC) is a type of company that can be formed by a single individual as both shareholder and director, introduced under the Companies Act, 2013. An OPC is a unique business structure for a single entrepreneur that combines the simplicity of a sole proprietorship with the legal protections of a corporate entity. It is defined under Section 2(62) of the Companies Act, 2013, as a company with only one member.

keyFeatures: Limited Liability – Personal assets are protected
Separate Legal Entity – Recognized as a company under law
Less Compliance – Fewer requirements than private limited companies
Perpetual Succession – Nominee takes over in unforeseen events
Credibility – Trusted by banks, customers, and vendors
idealFor: Solo entrepreneurs starting their business journey
Small business owners seeking limited liability

process.title: Digital Signature Certificate (DSC)
process.description: Obtain DSC for the director to digitally sign documents during the registration process.

process.title: Director Identification Number (DIN)
process.description: Apply for DIN for the director through MCA portal with required documents.

process.title: Name Reservation
process.description: Reserve unique company name through SPICe+ form with alternative name options.

process.title: Document Preparation
process.description: Prepare Memorandum of Association (MoA), Articles of Association (AoA), and other incorporation documents.

process.title: SPICe+ Form Filing
process.description: Submit SPICe+ form with all documents and fees to MCA for incorporation approval.

process.title: Certificate of Incorporation
process.description: Receive Certificate of Incorporation, PAN, TAN, and complete post-incorporation formalities.

forRegisteredOffice: Property tax receipt or municipal bill

eligibilityCriteria: Any Indian citizen, whether resident in India or otherwise
Cannot incorporate more than one OPC

taxation.incomeTax: 22% to 30% + Surcharge + Cess (treated as separate legal entity)
taxation.tds: Must comply with TDS provisions from day one
taxation.gst: Required if turnover exceeds ₹20 lakh (₹10 lakh in special category states)

faqs.question: What is a One Person Company (OPC)?
faqs.answer: An OPC is a business structure defined under the Companies Act of 2013 that allows a single individual to form and run a company. It is a unique entity that gives a sole entrepreneur the benefits of a corporate organization, such as limited liability, while maintaining full control.

faqs.question: What are the main benefits of registering an OPC?
faqs.answer: The key advantages include: Limited Liability (personal assets are protected), Separate Legal Entity (distinct legal identity), Perpetual Succession (nominee can take over), and Less Compliance (fewer requirements than private limited companies).

faqs.question: Is an OPC suitable for small businesses?
faqs.answer: Yes, an OPC is an ideal choice for solo entrepreneurs, freelancers, and small business owners who are seeking the legal protection of a corporate structure without needing partners or multiple directors.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to form a One Person Company?
faqs.answer: To form an OPC, the individual must be a natural person and an Indian citizen. As per the Companies (Incorporation) Second Amendment Rules, 2021, any Indian citizen, whether resident in India or otherwise, is now eligible to form an OPC.

faqs.question: Can a Non-Resident Indian (NRI) register an OPC?
faqs.answer: Yes, as per the Companies (Incorporation) Second Amendment Rules, 2021, any Indian citizen, whether resident in India or otherwise, is now eligible to form an OPC.

faqs.question: Do I need to appoint a nominee?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is mandatory for the sole director and member of an OPC to appoint a nominee. The nominee must also be a natural person and an Indian citizen.

faqs.question: Are there any specific board meeting or AGM requirements for an OPC?
faqs.answer: If an OPC has only one director, it is not mandatory to hold an Annual General Meeting (AGM) or board meetings. However, if there is more than one director, at least one board meeting must be held in each half of a calendar year, with a gap of at least 90 days between meetings.

faqs.question: What are the key annual compliance requirements for an OPC?
faqs.answer: An OPC must file its financial statements and annual returns with the MCA. This includes e-forms like AOC-4 for financial statements and MGT-7A for the annual return.

faqs.question: Is a statutory audit mandatory for an OPC?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is a requirement to appoint a statutory auditor within 30 days of incorporation.

faqs.question: Have the turnover and paid-up capital limits for OPCs been removed?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Companies (Incorporation) Second Amendment Rules, 2021, removed the mandatory conversion requirements for OPCs based on their paid-up capital (previously ₹50 lakhs) or average annual turnover (previously ₹2 crore). An OPC can now grow indefinitely without being forced to convert to a private or public company.

faqs.question: Can an OPC voluntarily convert into a private company?
faqs.answer: Yes, an OPC can voluntarily convert into a private or public company at any time by passing a special resolution and fulfilling the requirements for the new company type, such as increasing the number of members and directors.

faqs.question: What are the common reasons for OPC application rejection?
faqs.answer: An OPC application can be rejected for several reasons, including: Incorrect or incomplete documentation, proposed company name too similar to existing name, failure to meet eligibility criteria, or errors in the Digital Signature Certificate (DSC) or Director Identification Number (DIN).

llp.title: Limited Liability Partnership Registration
llp.description: Combine the benefits of partnership flexibility with corporate liability protection for your business.

whatIs.title: What is a Limited Liability Partnership?
whatIs.description: A Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) is a hybrid business structure that combines the operational flexibility of a partnership with the limited liability benefits of a corporation. Partners are not personally liable for the misconduct or negligence of other partners.

process.title: Name Reservation
process.description: Apply for LLP Name Reservation through MCA portal.

process.title: DSC & DIN
process.description: Obtain Digital Signature Certificate and Director Identification Number for designated partners.

process.title: LLP Agreement
process.description: Draft and execute LLP agreement defining partnership terms.

process.title: Registration Filing
process.description: Submit incorporation documents to MCA.

process.title: Certificate Issuance
process.description: Receive LLP incorporation certificate and complete post-registration formalities.

faqs.question: What is the minimum number of partners required for LLP?
faqs.answer: A minimum of 2 partners are required to form an LLP. There is no maximum limit on the number of partners.

faqs.question: Is there any minimum capital requirement for LLP?
faqs.answer: No, there is no minimum capital requirement for LLP registration.

faqs.question: What are the annual compliance requirements for LLP?
faqs.answer: LLPs need to file annual returns, maintain books of accounts, and comply with income tax and GST requirements.

sole-proprietorship.title: Sole Proprietorship Registration
sole-proprietorship.description: Start your business journey with the simplest form of business registration - perfect for individual entrepreneurs and small businesses.

whatIs.title: What is a Sole Proprietorship?
whatIs.description: A Sole Proprietorship is the simplest form of business structure where an individual owns and operates the business. The owner has complete control and receives all profits, but also bears all risks and liabilities.

process.title: Document Collection
process.description: Gather required documents including identity proof, address proof, and business details.

process.title: Business Name Registration
process.description: Register your business name and obtain necessary licenses.

process.title: GST Registration
process.description: Apply for GST registration if required based on turnover.

process.title: MSME Registration
process.description: Register under MSME for additional benefits and recognition.

process.title: Bank Account Setup
process.description: Assistance in opening a current account for business transactions.

forProprietor: Bank statement/utility bill for address proof

faqs.question: What is the minimum capital required for Sole Proprietorship?
faqs.answer: There is no minimum capital requirement for starting a Sole Proprietorship. You can start with any amount of capital.

faqs.question: Can a Sole Proprietorship be converted to a Company later?
faqs.answer: Yes, a Sole Proprietorship can be converted to a Private Limited Company or OPC when the business grows and requires a more formal structure.

faqs.question: What are the tax implications for Sole Proprietorship?
faqs.answer: The proprietor's business income is taxed as personal income under the Income Tax Act. GST registration is required if turnover exceeds ₹20 lakhs (₹10 lakhs for special category states).

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to register a Sole Proprietorship?
faqs.answer: While Sole Proprietorship doesn't require mandatory registration, it's advisable to register for GST, MSME, and obtain necessary licenses for legal compliance and business credibility.

section-8-company.title: Section 8 Company Registration
section-8-company.description: Register a non-profit company under Section 8 to promote charitable activities, education, commerce, art, science, or social welfare.

whatIs.title: What is a Section 8 Company?
whatIs.description: A Section 8 Company is a non-profit organization incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013. It is formed to promote charitable activities, education, commerce, art, science, or any other useful object, and prohibits payment of dividends to its members.

process.title: Name Reservation
process.description: Apply for name approval with specific objects clause

process.title: Document Preparation
process.description: Draft MOA, AOA and prepare incorporation documents

process.title: Digital Signatures
process.description: Obtain DSC and DIN for proposed directors

process.title: Filing Application
process.description: File incorporation application with ROC

process.title: License Approval
process.description: Obtain Section 8 license from Central Government

faqs.question: What is the difference between Section 8 Company and Trust?
faqs.answer: Section 8 Company is incorporated under Companies Act with limited liability and better structure, while Trust is created under Indian Trusts Act with unlimited liability for trustees.

faqs.question: Can Section 8 Company distribute profits?
faqs.answer: No, Section 8 Companies cannot distribute dividends or profits to members. All income must be used for promoting the stated objects.

faqs.question: Is there any minimum capital requirement?
faqs.answer: There is no minimum paid-up capital requirement for Section 8 Companies.

subsidiary-foreign-company.title: Subsidiary of a Foreign Company Registration
subsidiary-foreign-company.description: Establish a subsidiary of your foreign company in India to expand your business operations with complete legal compliance.

whatIs.title: What is a Subsidiary of Foreign Company?
whatIs.description: A subsidiary of a foreign company is an Indian company where the foreign company holds more than 50% of the paid-up share capital. It operates as a separate legal entity in India while being controlled by the foreign parent company.

documents: Certificate of incorporation of foreign company

process.title: Structure Planning
process.description: Plan the subsidiary structure and compliance requirements

process.title: Name Reservation
process.description: Reserve company name with ROC

process.title: Incorporation
process.description: File incorporation documents and obtain certificate

process.title: FEMA Compliance
process.description: Complete RBI reporting and FEMA formalities

process.title: Banking & Operations
process.description: Open bank accounts and commence operations

forForeignCompany: Certificate of incorporation of foreign company

faqs.question: What is the minimum capital requirement?
faqs.answer: There is no minimum capital requirement, but the investment must comply with FDI policy and FEMA regulations.

faqs.question: Can a foreign company own 100% of the subsidiary?
faqs.answer: Yes, in most sectors, 100% foreign ownership is allowed. However, some sectors have FDI caps that must be followed.

faqs.question: What are the ongoing compliance requirements?
faqs.answer: Regular RBI reporting, annual filings with ROC, tax compliance, and FEMA compliance for fund transfers.

nidhi-company.title: Nidhi Company Registration
nidhi-company.description: Establish a Nidhi Company for borrowing and lending among members with mutual benefit and financial cooperation.

whatIs.title: What is a Nidhi Company?
whatIs.description: A Nidhi Company is a non-banking finance company that facilitates the borrowing and lending of money between its members. It operates on mutual benefit principles and is regulated under the Companies Act, 2013.

process.title: Name Application
process.description: Apply for name reservation with 'Nidhi Limited' suffix

process.title: Document Preparation
process.description: Prepare MOA, AOA as per Nidhi Rules

process.title: DSC & DIN
process.description: Obtain digital signatures and director identification numbers

process.title: Incorporation
process.description: File incorporation forms with MCA

process.title: Compliance Setup
process.description: Set up compliance framework as per Nidhi Rules

faqs.question: What is the minimum number of members required for a Nidhi Company?
faqs.answer: A Nidhi Company must have a minimum of 7 members at the time of incorporation and should have at least 200 members within one year of commencement of business.

faqs.question: Can a Nidhi Company accept deposits from non-members?
faqs.answer: No, Nidhi Companies can only accept deposits from their members and cannot accept deposits from the general public or non-members.

faqs.question: What is the minimum paid-up capital for a Nidhi Company?
faqs.answer: The minimum paid-up capital for a Nidhi Company is ₹5 lakhs, and it must be paid in cash only.

producer-company.title: Producer Company Registration
producer-company.description: Form a company owned by primary producers or farmers to collectively engage in production, harvesting, and marketing activities.

whatIs.title: What is a Producer Company?
whatIs.description: A Producer Company is a corporate entity formed by primary producers (farmers, artisans, etc.) to collectively undertake production, harvesting, procurement, grading, pooling, handling, marketing, selling, and export of primary produce.

process.title: Member Verification
process.description: Verify producer status of all members

process.title: Name Reservation
process.description: Apply for company name with 'Producer Company Limited' suffix

process.title: Documentation
process.description: Prepare MOA, AOA as per Producer Company provisions

process.title: Filing
process.description: File incorporation documents with MCA

process.title: Registration
process.description: Obtain Certificate of Incorporation

faqs.question: Who can be a member of a Producer Company?
faqs.answer: Only primary producers such as farmers, cultivators, artisans, or persons engaged in activities connected with primary produce can be members of a Producer Company.

faqs.question: What is the minimum number of members required?
faqs.answer: A Producer Company requires a minimum of 10 members for incorporation, and all members must be primary producers.

faqs.question: Can a Producer Company engage in non-agricultural activities?
faqs.answer: Producer Companies can only engage in activities related to primary produce including production, harvesting, procurement, grading, pooling, handling, marketing, selling, and export.

partnership-firm.title: Partnership Firm Registration
partnership-firm.description: Create a partnership between two or more individuals to run a business together with shared profits, losses, and responsibilities.

whatIs.title: What is a Partnership Firm?
whatIs.description: A Partnership Firm is a business structure where two or more individuals come together to carry on a business with a common goal of earning profits. Partners share profits, losses, and management responsibilities as per the partnership agreement.

process.title: Partnership Agreement
process.description: Draft comprehensive partnership deed defining terms

process.title: Name Search
process.description: Search and finalize firm name availability

process.title: Registration
process.description: File application with Registrar of Firms

process.title: Certificate
process.description: Obtain Certificate of Registration

process.title: Other Registrations
process.description: Apply for PAN, bank account, and other licenses

faqs.question: Is registration of partnership firm mandatory?
faqs.answer: Registration of partnership firm is optional under the Partnership Act, 1932. However, unregistered firms face certain legal disadvantages and cannot file suits against third parties.

faqs.question: What is the maximum number of partners allowed?
faqs.answer: Under the Partnership Act, a partnership firm can have a maximum of 20 partners. For banking business, the limit is 10 partners.

faqs.question: Can partners have different profit sharing ratios?
faqs.answer: Yes, partners can agree to any profit and loss sharing ratio as mentioned in the partnership deed. If not specified, profits and losses are shared equally.
